Legal_Issue: Can the Court issue a nunc pro tunc order to avoid the termination of Shukla's immigration application under s. 87.4(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act?
Governing_Law: Section 87.4(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Legal_Rule: Section 87.4(1) terminates applications for permanent resident visas in the federal skilled worker category if not decided by March 29, 2012.
Procedural_Issue: Whether a nunc pro tunc order could reinstate the application
Grounds_for_Claim: Legislative termination of application due to no decision by March 29, 2012
Key_Evidence_Considered: Application submitted before February 27, 2008; no decision by March 29, 2012
Applicant_Challenge: Seeking judicial review to reinstate terminated application via nunc pro tunc order
Remedy_Requested: Nunc pro tunc order to reinstate application
Outcome: Termination upheld; no jurisdiction to override legislative intent
Legal_Provision: s. 87.4(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Claimant_Status: Applicant for permanent residency under federal skilled worker category
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Automatic termination under s. 87.4(1) due to undetermined status by cutoff date
Governing_Rule: s. 87.4(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
